name: Evadre
description:
This game concept was inspired by the in-person escape rooms that were extremely popular prior to the pandemic. People are required to pay a fee and then have the ability to choose an escape room theme they would like to complete with a group of friends. Throughout these rooms, people must solve unique puzzles with the hints they are given in each room in order to progress to different rooms and inevitably escape (e.g. unlocking doors, finding hidden paths, collecting items, decoding ciphers, etc.)

There is also a timer that gradually goes down (in-person it is roughly around 50 minutes, in Evadere it is 10 minutes). Once time runs out in an escape room, the player(s) lose and have failed the escape room as a result.

Contributors: 

- Alexander Dispenza (Gameplay programmer) 

-John Annoya(Gameplay programmer)
